item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenAI is shockingly good at unminifying code (165 points | 97 comments)
2. Show HN: Low Cost Mini PCs (26 points | 11 comments)
3. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1247 points | 303 comments)
4. Show HN: Homemade Automated Solar Concentrator (78 points | 9 comments)
5. Computer Scientists Prove That Heat Destroys Entanglement (79 points | 27 comments)
6. Show HN: turn videos into ASCII art (open source, js+canvas) (27 points | 7 comments)
7. UK rail minister got engineer sacked for raising safety concerns (190 points | 110 comments)
8. Two Dots Too Many (2008) (37 points | 19 comments)
9. Docusaurus – Build optimized websites quickly, focus on your content (93 points | 26 comments)
10. I spent an evening on a fictitious web (23 points | 12 comments)
11. Superhuman Built an Engine to Find Product Market Fit (2018) (17 points | 5 comments)

13. What Life Means to Einstein (1929) [pdf] (64 points | 36 comments)
14. The first snapshot of Hacker News on Archive.org (32 points | 8 comments)

16. Type 2 diabetes drug associated with 35% lower risk of dementia, study finds (49 points | 14 comments)
17. Windmill (YC S22) Hiring Rust and TypeScript Eng #3 in Paris ( | hide)
18. Window Maker: X11 window manager with the look and feel of the NeXTSTEP UI (241 points | 121 comments)
19. Ask HN: Developer PC setup automations for company owned devices (4 points | 3 comments)
20. Google's new pipe syntax in SQL (290 points | 144 comments)
21. Show HN: Firebuilder: A complete Firefox customization tool (106 points | 10 comments)
22. Open-source alternative to Loom that only requires S3 (25 points | 6 comments)
23. Linus Torvalds talks AI, Rust, & why Linux is the only thing that matters (34 points | 13 comments)
24. Show HN: LLM-Term – Simple Rust-based CLI assist tool (11 points | 3 comments)
25. The Future of TLA+ [pdf] (179 points | 73 comments)
26. If you love something set it free – AKWF Waveforms now in public domain (2015) (19 points | 3 comments)
27. KDE Asking for Donations (8 points | 2 comments)
28. Scaling Rails and Postgres to millions of users at Microsoft (176 points | 53 comments)
29. Panasonic Toughbook 40 (183 points | 165 comments)
30. Monumental architecture in Atlantic Europe: fifth-millennium BC enclosure (44 points | 2 comments)
